fees.question: How much are my fees?
fees.answer: Fees are broken down into two categories – Student Contribution Fee and Tuition Fee. Most Undergraduate students qualify for free Tuition fees under the HEA Free Fees Initiative. Further details: https://tus.ie/fees

fees.question: I am a Flexible Learning Student – What fees apply to me?
fees.answer: Flexible Learning has a separate Fees department. Visit the Flexible Learning section here: https://tus.ie/flexible-learning

fees.question: When do I need to pay fees for the academic year 2023/2024?
fees.answer: EU students can pay in two instalments. The first is due by 31 October 2023, and the second by 15 January 2024.

fees.question: How do I pay my fees?
fees.answer: Students can pay online as part of the registration process using a credit/debit card. A receipt will be emailed to your student email. More info: https://tus.ie/pay-fees

grants.question: How/where do I apply for a Grant?
grants.answer: SUSI is the awarding grants body in Ireland. Apply for a grant at: https://www.susi.ie/

grants.question: I am awaiting a SUSI grant decision – Can I still register?
grants.answer: Yes, you can be temporarily registered without paying fees but must provide your SUSI application number.

grants.question: I have been approved for a Maintenance Grant, how will it be paid?
grants.answer: SUSI pays maintenance grants in nine monthly instalments via electronic fund transfer to your bank account.

grants.question: What happens if I have already paid my fees and I am subsequently awarded a Grant?
grants.answer: To receive a refund, input your bank details on your student portal.

non_payment.question: What happens if I don’t pay my fees on time?
non_payment.answer: Non-payment may result in late fees, IT access removal, withheld exam results, and inability to register for future years.

non_payment.question: Can I sit my semester two examinations if my fees have not been paid in full?
non_payment.answer: Yes, but a ‘hold’ will be placed on your registration record, applying restrictions.

non_payment.question: If I have to repeat the year/modules, do I have to pay fees?
non_payment.answer: Yes, the cost is based on the number of credits to repeat. More details: https://tus.ie/repeat-fees

non_payment.question: How can I get a hold removed from my account?
non_payment.answer: Pay outstanding fees in full. Processing may take 1-2 working days.

miscellaneous.question: Can I claim tax relief on my fees?
miscellaneous.answer: Visit Revenue Online for tax relief details: https://www.revenue.ie/

miscellaneous.question: Can TUS issue an invoice to my Company?
miscellaneous.answer: Yes, TUS can issue an invoice upon completing a Sponsorship Agreement form. Download here: https://tus.ie/sponsorship-agreement

online_payment.description: Students can pay their fees online using a debit or credit card through the TUS Student Portal.
steps: Log in to the TUS Student Portal using your student credentials.
Select 'Account Balance by Term' for the relevant academic year.
Select the checkbox for the academic year you wish to pay for.
If making a partial payment, edit the amount in the 'Net Term Balance' field.
Press 'Pay Now' to proceed to the payment gateway.
online_payment.note: Payment is not accessible using a mobile device; please use a laptop or desktop computer.

payment_deadlines.description: To avoid late fees and ensure continued access to university services, adhere to the following payment schedule:

deadlines.penalty: A €50 late payment fee will be applied if not paid by this date.
IT access will be removed if full payment is not received by this date.

payment_deadlines.note: For students with financial difficulties, an installment plan is available. Contact the Grants & Fees Office to set up an agreed, signed installment plan.

contact_information.description: For assistance or to discuss payment options, please contact the Grants & Fees Office.
